lvmh.name: Bernard Arnault
lvmh.bio: Billionaire businessman who built LVMH into the world's largest luxury goods conglomerate.

lvmh.name: Antonio Belloni
lvmh.bio: Long-serving managing director overseeing LVMH's global operations since 2001.

lvmh.name: Delphine Arnault
lvmh.bio: Eldest child of Bernard Arnault who rose through LVMH ranks to lead the Dior fashion house.

lvmh.name: Antoine Arnault
lvmh.bio: Son of Bernard Arnault overseeing LVMH's global communications and environmental strategy.

groupe-bollor.name: Vincent Bolloré
groupe-bollor.bio: French industrialist who transformed Bolloré Group into a major media and logistics conglomerate.

groupe-bollor.name: Cyrille Bolloré
groupe-bollor.bio: Son of Vincent Bolloré who succeeded his father as head of the Bolloré Group.

groupe-bollor.name: Yannick Bolloré
groupe-bollor.bio: Son of Vincent Bolloré who chairs Vivendi, the media arm of the Bolloré empire.

groupe-bollor.name: Cédric de Bailliencourt
groupe-bollor.bio: Senior executive managing the group's international logistics and transport division.

kering.name: François-Henri Pinault
kering.bio: French billionaire who transformed Kering from a retail conglomerate into a global luxury goods powerhouse.

kering.name: Jean-Marc Duplaix
kering.bio: Long-time CFO responsible for Kering's financial strategy and investor relations.

kering.name: Francesca Bellettini
kering.role: CEO of Saint Laurent & Deputy CEO of Kering
kering.bio: Italian executive who drove the revival of the Saint Laurent brand under Kering.

kering.name: Jean-François Palus
kering.bio: Veteran Kering executive who served as group managing director for over a decade.

grand-synagogue-of-paris-la-victoire.name: Moché Sebbag
grand-synagogue-of-paris-la-victoire.bio: Chief Rabbi of the Grand Synagogue of Paris since 1987, a prominent figure in French Jewish religious life.

grand-synagogue-of-paris-la-victoire.name: Joël Mergui
grand-synagogue-of-paris-la-victoire.role: President of the Consistoire de Paris
grand-synagogue-of-paris-la-victoire.bio: President of the Paris Consistory overseeing the administration of the Grand Synagogue.

grand-synagogue-of-paris-la-victoire.name: Jacques Hélian
grand-synagogue-of-paris-la-victoire.role: Former President of the Synagogue Council
grand-synagogue-of-paris-la-victoire.bio: Community leader involved in the cultural and administrative activities of the Grand Synagogue.

radio-shalom.name: Serge Hajdenberg
radio-shalom.bio: Founded Radio Shalom in 1981 as one of France's first Jewish community radio stations.

radio-shalom.name: Sandrine Sebbane
radio-shalom.bio: Longtime journalist and presenter covering French Jewish community affairs on Radio Shalom.

radio-shalom.name: Gabriel Mergui
radio-shalom.bio: Managed Radio Shalom's programming focusing on Jewish cultural and community content.

sephora.name: Guillaume Motte
sephora.bio: Appointed to lead Sephora's global operations as part of the LVMH luxury group.

sephora.name: Dominique Mandonnaud
sephora.bio: French entrepreneur who founded Sephora in 1970 and pioneered the open-sell cosmetics retail concept.

sephora.name: Martin Brok
sephora.bio: Led Sephora's international expansion strategy before transitioning leadership.

sephora.name: Jean-André Rougeot
sephora.bio: Oversaw Sephora's rapid growth in the North American market.

soci-t-g-n-rale.name: Slawomir Krupa
soci-t-g-n-rale.bio: Polish-born banker who became CEO of Societe Generale in 2023, focusing on strategic transformation.

soci-t-g-n-rale.name: Lorenzo Bini Smaghi
soci-t-g-n-rale.bio: Italian economist and former ECB executive board member who chairs Societe Generale.

soci-t-g-n-rale.name: Frédéric Oudéa
soci-t-g-n-rale.bio: Led Societe Generale for over a decade through the financial crisis and subsequent restructuring.

soci-t-g-n-rale.name: Daniel Bouton
soci-t-g-n-rale.bio: Headed Societe Generale during its major expansion period and the 2008 trading scandal.

kl-pierre.name: Jean-Marc Jestin
kl-pierre.role: Former Chairman of the Executive Board
kl-pierre.bio: Led Klépierre's transformation into one of Europe's leading shopping center real estate investment trusts.

kl-pierre.name: Jean-Michel Gault
kl-pierre.bio: Oversaw Klépierre's financial operations and capital markets strategy across Europe.

kl-pierre.name: David Simon
kl-pierre.bio: Former Simon Property Group executive who chairs Klépierre's supervisory board.

jcall-european-jewish-call-for-reason.name: David Chemla
jcall-european-jewish-call-for-reason.bio: French activist who co-founded JCall to advocate for a two-state solution from a European Jewish perspective.

jcall-european-jewish-call-for-reason.name: Daniel Cohn-Bendit
jcall-european-jewish-call-for-reason.bio: Franco-German politician and former MEP who helped launch JCall as a pro-peace European Jewish movement.

jcall-european-jewish-call-for-reason.name: Bernard-Henri Lévy
jcall-european-jewish-call-for-reason.bio: Prominent French philosopher and public intellectual who supported JCall's appeal for Israeli-Palestinian peace.

acad-mie-hillel.name: Franklin Rausky
acad-mie-hillel.bio: Scholar and educator who directed Académie Hillel's programs in Jewish studies and philosophy in Paris.

acad-mie-hillel.name: Raphy Marciano
acad-mie-hillel.bio: Helped establish Académie Hillel as a center for adult Jewish education in Paris.

acad-mie-hillel.name: Alexis Blum
acad-mie-hillel.bio: Former Grand Rabbi of Strasbourg who contributed to Académie Hillel's educational mission.

union-des-tudiants-juifs-de-france-uejf.name: Samuel Lejoyeux
union-des-tudiants-juifs-de-france-uejf.bio: Led UEJF's advocacy against antisemitism and promotion of Jewish student life on French university campuses.

union-des-tudiants-juifs-de-france-uejf.name: Alain Finkielkraut
union-des-tudiants-juifs-de-france-uejf.bio: French philosopher who was active in UEJF before becoming one of France's leading public intellectuals.

union-des-tudiants-juifs-de-france-uejf.name: Raphaël Haddad
union-des-tudiants-juifs-de-france-uejf.bio: Led UEJF campaigns against antisemitism and for Holocaust remembrance among French youth.

cercle-bernard-lazare.name: Jean-Claude Gayssot
cercle-bernard-lazare.bio: French politician whose anti-racism legislation was supported by Cercle Bernard Lazare activism.

cercle-bernard-lazare.name: Richard Odier
cercle-bernard-lazare.bio: Led Cercle Bernard Lazare's mission of promoting dialogue and progressive values within the French Jewish community.

cercle-bernard-lazare.name: Lucien Lazare
cercle-bernard-lazare.bio: Historian of the French Jewish resistance who contributed to the circle's intellectual heritage.

alliance-isra-lite-universelle.name: Marc Eisenberg
alliance-isra-lite-universelle.bio: Businessman and communal leader who serves as president of the Alliance Israélite Universelle.

alliance-isra-lite-universelle.name: Jo Toledano
alliance-isra-lite-universelle.bio: Managed the AIU's global network of Jewish schools and its historic library in Paris.

alliance-isra-lite-universelle.name: Adolphe Crémieux
alliance-isra-lite-universelle.bio: French-Jewish statesman who co-founded the Alliance Israélite Universelle in 1860 to defend Jewish rights worldwide.

alliance-isra-lite-universelle.name: Aron Rodrigue
alliance-isra-lite-universelle.bio: Stanford historian specializing in the Alliance Israélite Universelle's educational impact in the Mediterranean world.

rothschild-co-france.name: Alexandre de Rothschild
rothschild-co-france.bio: Seventh-generation Rothschild family member leading the firm's global advisory and wealth management operations.

rothschild-co-france.name: David de Rothschild
rothschild-co-france.bio: Rebuilt Rothschild & Co into a leading independent financial advisory firm after its 2003 reunification.

rothschild-co-france.name: Robert Leitão
rothschild-co-france.role: Managing Partner & Co-CEO of Global Advisory
rothschild-co-france.bio: Senior partner overseeing Rothschild's global M&A advisory business.

rothschild-co-france.name: Marc Ladreit de Lacharrière
rothschild-co-france.bio: French businessman and cultural patron who serves on Rothschild & Co's governance board.

drancy-internment-camp-memorial.name: Serge Klarsfeld
drancy-internment-camp-memorial.bio: Nazi hunter and historian whose lifelong work documenting the deportation of French Jews was pivotal to the Drancy memorial.

drancy-internment-camp-memorial.name: Beate Klarsfeld
drancy-internment-camp-memorial.bio: Franco-German activist who alongside her husband fought to bring attention to Drancy's role in the Holocaust.

drancy-internment-camp-memorial.name: Annette Wieviorka
drancy-internment-camp-memorial.bio: French historian specializing in the Holocaust whose research contributed to the Drancy memorial's historical narrative.

m-morial-de-la-shoah-paris.name: Jacques Fredj
m-morial-de-la-shoah-paris.bio: Long-serving director of the Mémorial de la Shoah who oversaw its expansion into a major Holocaust museum and research center.

m-morial-de-la-shoah-paris.name: Éric de Rothschild
m-morial-de-la-shoah-paris.bio: French banker and philanthropist who served as president of the Mémorial de la Shoah for many years.

m-morial-de-la-shoah-paris.name: Serge Klarsfeld
m-morial-de-la-shoah-paris.bio: Holocaust historian and Nazi hunter who played a key role in documenting victims commemorated at the memorial.

m-morial-de-la-shoah-paris.name: Simone Veil
m-morial-de-la-shoah-paris.bio: Auschwitz survivor, former French minister and European Parliament president who was an iconic figure of Holocaust remembrance.

ose-uvre-de-secours-aux-enfants.name: Patricia Sitruk
ose-uvre-de-secours-aux-enfants.bio: Led OSE's modern operations providing health, education and social services to vulnerable populations in France.

ose-uvre-de-secours-aux-enfants.name: Jean-François Guthmann
ose-uvre-de-secours-aux-enfants.bio: Oversaw OSE's governance and its continued mission of child welfare and medical assistance.

ose-uvre-de-secours-aux-enfants.name: Andrée Salomon
ose-uvre-de-secours-aux-enfants.bio: OSE social worker who organized the rescue of hundreds of Jewish children from Vichy French internment camps during World War II.

ose-uvre-de-secours-aux-enfants.name: Ernst Papanek
ose-uvre-de-secours-aux-enfants.bio: Austrian-born educator who directed OSE children's homes in France, saving refugee children before the Nazi occupation.

institut-europ-en-emmanuel-levinas.name: Shmuel Trigano
institut-europ-en-emmanuel-levinas.bio: French-Jewish sociologist and philosopher who helped establish the institute to promote Levinas's philosophical legacy.

institut-europ-en-emmanuel-levinas.name: Benny Lévy
institut-europ-en-emmanuel-levinas.bio: Franco-Egyptian philosopher who co-founded the institute dedicated to Jewish philosophical studies in the tradition of Levinas.

institut-europ-en-emmanuel-levinas.name: Marc Eisenberg
institut-europ-en-emmanuel-levinas.bio: French businessman who supported Jewish educational institutions including the Levinas Institute through philanthropy.

uejf-union-of-jewish-students-of-france.name: Samuel Lejoyeux
uejf-union-of-jewish-students-of-france.bio: Student leader heading UEJF's fight against antisemitism and advocacy for Jewish campus life in France.

uejf-union-of-jewish-students-of-france.name: Jonathan Arfi
uejf-union-of-jewish-students-of-france.bio: Former UEJF president who went on to hold leadership roles in French Jewish communal organizations.

uejf-union-of-jewish-students-of-france.name: Sacha Ghozlan
uejf-union-of-jewish-students-of-france.bio: Led UEJF's anti-hate campaigns and later became involved in broader French Jewish advocacy.

uejf-union-of-jewish-students-of-france.name: Yonathan Arfi
uejf-union-of-jewish-students-of-france.bio: Rose through UEJF ranks to eventually become president of CRIF, the main French Jewish representative body.

spcj-service-de-protection-de-la-communa.name: Sammy Ghozlan
spcj-service-de-protection-de-la-communa.bio: Retired police commissioner who founded SPCJ to provide security monitoring and protection for French Jewish institutions.

spcj-service-de-protection-de-la-communa.name: Meyer Habib
spcj-service-de-protection-de-la-communa.bio: French-Israeli politician who championed the security needs of France's Jewish community in parliament.

spcj-service-de-protection-de-la-communa.name: Yonathan Arfi
spcj-service-de-protection-de-la-communa.bio: As CRIF president, works closely with SPCJ on security coordination for the French Jewish community.

keren-hayesod-france.name: Marc Eisenberg
keren-hayesod-france.bio: Major French Jewish philanthropist and communal leader supporting Keren Hayesod's fundraising for Israel.

keren-hayesod-france.name: Claude Bébéar
keren-hayesod-france.bio: French insurance magnate and founder of AXA who supported Franco-Israeli philanthropic efforts.

keren-hayesod-france.name: Ariel Goldmann
keren-hayesod-france.bio: French Jewish communal leader involved in coordinating philanthropic support for Israel through Keren Hayesod.

radio-j-radio-shalom.name: Serge Hajdenberg
radio-j-radio-shalom.bio: Pioneer of French Jewish broadcasting who launched Radio J and Radio Shalom in the early 1980s.

radio-j-radio-shalom.name: Emmanuel Rials
radio-j-radio-shalom.bio: Journalist contributing to Radio J's coverage of French Jewish affairs and Israeli news.

radio-j-radio-shalom.name: Frédéric Haziza
radio-j-radio-shalom.bio: Political journalist known for hosting programs on Radio J covering French politics and Jewish community issues.

bpifrance-french-israeli-business-networ.name: Nicolas Dufourcq
bpifrance-french-israeli-business-networ.bio: CEO of BPIfrance, France's public investment bank supporting innovation and international business partnerships.

bpifrance-french-israeli-business-networ.name: Paul Hermelin
bpifrance-french-israeli-business-networ.bio: Former Capgemini chairman who sits on BPIfrance's strategic council and supports Franco-Israeli tech collaboration.

bpifrance-french-israeli-business-networ.name: Ségolène Royal
bpifrance-french-israeli-business-networ.bio: French politician who served in BPIfrance governance and promoted international economic partnerships.

synagogue-de-la-victoire-paris.name: Moché Sebbag
synagogue-de-la-victoire-paris.bio: Serves as Grand Rabbi of the Great Synagogue of Paris on Rue de la Victoire since 1987.

synagogue-de-la-victoire-paris.name: Joël Mergui
synagogue-de-la-victoire-paris.bio: Heads the Paris Consistory which administers the Synagogue de la Victoire and other Parisian synagogues.

synagogue-de-la-victoire-paris.name: Haïm Korsia
synagogue-de-la-victoire-paris.bio: Chief Rabbi of France who regularly presides over major ceremonies at the historic Victoire synagogue.

sodexo-israel-operations.name: Sophie Bellon
sodexo-israel-operations.bio: Daughter of founder Pierre Bellon who leads Sodexo, one of the world's largest food services and facilities management companies.

sodexo-israel-operations.name: Pierre Bellon
sodexo-israel-operations.bio: French entrepreneur who founded Sodexo in 1966 and built it into a global food services giant.

sodexo-israel-operations.name: Denis Machuel
sodexo-israel-operations.bio: Led Sodexo's global operations and international expansion including Middle Eastern markets.

fondation-pour-la-memoire-de-la-shoah.name: Philippe Allouche
fondation-pour-la-memoire-de-la-shoah.bio: Leads the foundation's mission to support Holocaust remembrance, education, and solidarity programs in France.

fondation-pour-la-memoire-de-la-shoah.name: David de Rothschild
fondation-pour-la-memoire-de-la-shoah.bio: French banker and philanthropist who presides over the Fondation pour la Mémoire de la Shoah.

fondation-pour-la-memoire-de-la-shoah.name: Simone Veil
fondation-pour-la-memoire-de-la-shoah.bio: Auschwitz survivor and iconic French stateswoman who served as the foundation's first president from 2000 until 2007.

fondation-pour-la-memoire-de-la-shoah.name: Serge Klarsfeld
fondation-pour-la-memoire-de-la-shoah.bio: Renowned Holocaust historian whose documentation work closely complements the foundation's remembrance mission.

bureau-national-de-vigilance-contre-l-an.name: Sammy Ghozlan
bureau-national-de-vigilance-contre-l-an.bio: Retired French police commissioner who founded BNVCA in 2002 to monitor and combat antisemitic acts in France.

bureau-national-de-vigilance-contre-l-an.name: Meyer Habib
bureau-national-de-vigilance-contre-l-an.bio: Former French parliamentarian who worked with BNVCA to strengthen legal responses to antisemitism.

bureau-national-de-vigilance-contre-l-an.name: Gilles-William Goldnadel
bureau-national-de-vigilance-contre-l-an.bio: French-Israeli lawyer and author who has collaborated with BNVCA in legal battles against antisemitism.

consistoire-central.name: Joël Mergui
consistoire-central.bio: Leads the Consistoire Central, the body governing organized Jewish religious life in France since Napoleon's era.

consistoire-central.name: Haïm Korsia
consistoire-central.bio: Elected Grand Rabbi of France in 2014, serving as the spiritual leader under the Consistoire's authority.

consistoire-central.name: Michel Gugenheim
consistoire-central.bio: Serves as Grand Rabbi of Paris within the Consistoire's religious leadership structure.

consistoire-central.name: Napoléon Bonaparte
consistoire-central.bio: Established the Consistoire system in 1808 to organize and regulate Jewish communal life in France.

fonds-social-juif-unifie.name: Ariel Goldmann
fonds-social-juif-unifie.bio: Lawyer and communal leader presiding over FSJU, the main social welfare and cultural coordinating body for French Jewry.

fonds-social-juif-unifie.name: Daniel Rouach
fonds-social-juif-unifie.bio: Manages FSJU's programs in education, culture, and social assistance for the French Jewish community.

fonds-social-juif-unifie.name: David Saada
fonds-social-juif-unifie.bio: Previously led FSJU's operations strengthening Jewish community infrastructure across France.

crif.name: Yonathan Arfi
crif.bio: Elected president of CRIF in 2022, representing France's Jewish community before government and civic institutions.

crif.name: Francis Kalifat
crif.bio: Led CRIF from 2016 to 2022, advocating against antisemitism and for Franco-Israeli relations.

crif.name: Roger Cukierman
crif.bio: Prominent French banker who served as CRIF president, strengthening its role in combating antisemitism.

crif.name: Richard Prasquier
crif.bio: Physician and communal leader who headed CRIF and championed Holocaust memory and interfaith dialogue.
